section.name: General
section.p: Beverly is an indexing system for Fedora digital object repositories and Apache Solr indexes.

section.name: Features
section.p: Beverly can index multiple repositories, and can use (in the extreme case) a separate indexing configuration for each and every object therein. It has highly-parallelized internal workflows and takes advantage of message queuing to offer good scaling characteristics. The index record object

section.name: Properties
section.p: Beverly relies on Fedora's ability to publish events about changes to repository contents. The configuration for indexing workflows is held in the repositories right next to the objects being indexed.
